name: Thief of Hearts
instructions:
1. Stir all of the ingredients (except the peaty scotch) with ice, then strain into a chilled coupe.
2. Float a cucumber slice on top of the drink, and top with 3 drops of the peaty scotch.
description: Emily Mistell describes this winter cocktail, named for a 1984 erotic drama, as an elegant Manhattan riff with seductive aromatics.

ingredients.name: Scotch whiskey
ingredients.description: Produced in Scotland, typically made from malted barley, and aged for a minimum period in oak barrels. Scotch can be further classified into single malt, single grain, blended malt, blended grain, and blended Scotch whisky.

ingredients.name: Dry Vermouth
ingredients.description: Dry Vermouth is a type of fortified wine that is aromatized with various botanicals, including herbs, spices, and sometimes citrus peels. It is characterized by its dry and less sweet profile compared to sweet vermouth. Dry Vermouth is a key ingredient in classic cocktails such as the Martini and the Manhattan, where it adds complexity and a subtle herbal note to the drink. It is typically white or pale yellow in color and is often enjoyed as a chilled aperitif on its own. The alcohol content of Dry Vermouth is fortified with additional spirits, usually grape brandy, which also contributes to its flavor and preservation.

ingredients.name: Apple Brandy
ingredients.description: Apple brandy is a distilled spirit made from fermented apple juice or cider. The production involves fermenting apples, distilling the resulting liquid, and often aging it in oak barrels. The final product can range from clear to amber in color and exhibits a variety of apple-derived flavors, influenced by the apple varieties used and the aging process. Apple brandy can be enjoyed on its own or used in cocktails and culinary applications. The term encompasses a broad category of apple-based spirits produced globally, with variations in production methods and flavor profiles.

ingredients.name: Maraschino
ingredients.description:
Liqueur obtained from the distillation of Marasca cherries. The small, slightly sour fruit of the Tapiwa cherry tree, which grows wild along parts of the Dalmatian coast in Croatia, lends the liqueur its unique aroma.

The Luxardo family, an Italian producer, is particularly well-known for its Maraschino liqueur.

ingredients.name: Pear Brandy (Williams)
ingredients.description:
The Purkhart Pear Williams Brandy uses only “Williams” pears from South Tirol (also known as Alto Adige or Südtirol), whose pears are prized for their opulent and creamy ripe fruit fragrance. Lively and stimulating on the palate, this eau-de-vie reveals a depth of pear flavor that carries well into the finish. Made only from distilled pears and water. Enjoy on its own, stir with dry vermouth for a perfumed Martini variation, or make uncommonly aromatic sour cocktails. 100% Reines Destillat Williamsbrand.

- Lively eau-de-vie distilled from Williams pears
- Williams pears have an opulent and creamy ripe fruit fragrance
- Floral, fruity complexity; makes aromatic sour cocktails
- Mix with dry vermouth and orange bitters for a Martini variation
- Purkhart has captured authentic regional tastes since 1932

ingredients.name: Honey Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made from dissolving honey in water.

ingredients.name: Orange bitters
ingredients.description: Orange bitters is a form of bitters, a cocktail flavoring made from such ingredients as the peels of Seville oranges, cardamom, caraway seed, coriander, anise, and burnt sugar in an alcohol base.

ingredients.name: Islay Scotch Whiskey
ingredients.description:
Islay Scotch refers to Scotch whisky that is produced on the Isle of Islay, which is one of the whisky-producing regions of Scotland. Islay whiskies are renowned for their distinctive and peaty character, often featuring robust and smoky flavors that set them apart from whiskies produced in other regions.

Well-known Islay distilleries include Ardbeg, Laphroaig, Lagavulin, and Bowmore, among others. Islay Scotch whiskies are appreciated by enthusiasts who enjoy the bold and distinctive flavor profile associated with the region. They are often enjoyed neat or with a splash of water to unlock the complexities of the spirit.
